Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.model.GameBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Board
public class GameBoard extends Object implements Board
Core game board implementation managing Tetris game logic. Handles brick movement, rotation with wall kicks, 7-Bag randomizer for piece generation, hold mechanic, and special game modes (Puzzle, Reverted).

    • rotateLeftBrick

      public boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Rotates the current brick counter-clockwise with wall kick support. Tests multiple offset positions to find a valid rotation spot.
      Specified by:
      rotateLeftBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if rotation was successful, false if rotation would cause collision

    • createNewBrick

      public boolean createNewBrick()
      Creates and spawns a new brick using the 7-Bag randomizer system. The bag ensures all 7 piece types are distributed evenly before refilling.
      Specified by:
      createNewBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the brick can be placed, false if game over condition is met

    • holdBrick

      public void holdBrick()
      Swaps the current brick with the held brick, or holds the current brick if none is held. Can only be used once per brick placement to prevent infinite swapping.
      Specified by:
      holdBrick in interface Board

      public int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Gets a copy of the current game board matrix.
      Specified by:
      getBoardMatrix in interface Board
      Returns:
      2D array representing the board state where 0 is empty and non-zero values represent brick colors

    • setupPuzzleMode

      public void setupPuzzleMode()
      Sets up the board for Puzzle mode by generating garbage rows at the bottom. Creates a partially filled board with one empty space per row to make it solvable.
      Specified by:
      setupPuzzleMode in interface Board
